sources.title: ORS Chapter 332 — Local Administration of Education
sources.summary: Oregon statute containing the legal requirements for filling school board vacancies, including timelines and procedures.

takeaways: Board Position 2 is vacant as of February 2026 — the board is filling this through the statutory appointment process.
Under ORS 332, the board has a limited timeframe to appoint a replacement — failure to act can trigger County involvement.
The appointment process typically includes public application, review, candidate interviews, and a board vote in public session.
An appointed board member serves until the next regular school board election, at which point the position goes to voters.
The Special Meeting on February 20, 2026 was dedicated to interviewing candidates for the Position 2 vacancy.

knowledgeCheck.question: An appointed board member serves a full four-year term.
knowledgeCheck.explanation: An appointed board member serves only until the next regular school board election, at which point the position is filled by voters.

knowledgeCheck.question: If a board fails to fill a vacancy within the statutory timeframe, what happens?
options: The county may intervene to fill the vacancy
A special election is automatically triggered
knowledgeCheck.explanation: Under Oregon law, if a board fails to fill a vacancy within the required timeframe, the county (ESD or county government) may step in to make the appointment.
